message: Hi, I’m really unhappy with the hotel we were booked into. It’s nothing like what was advertised, and I want a refund.

Hi, welcome to VoyageQuest! My name is Laura, and I’m truly sorry to hear about your experience. Let me quickly run through security so I can assist you right away. Could you please confirm your full name, date of birth, and booking reference number?
It’s Michael Thompson, DOB 5th February 1982, and the booking reference is VQ12321.

Thank you, Michael—that’s all correct, and security is now complete. I completely understand how disappointing it is when expectations aren’t met. Let me take a look at your booking details and investigate what happened with your hotel.
I don’t want excuses, I just want my money back. The photos showed a luxury room, and what we got was nothing close.

I completely understand how frustrating that must have been, Michael. I can see that the property was advertised as a 4-star luxury experience. However, according to company policy, refunds are only issued in cases of severe misrepresentation verified by the hotel itself.
So you’re telling me I just have to deal with it? This is awful customer service.

I’m truly sorry this experience hasn’t met your expectations, Michael. As an alternative, I’d like to suggest reaching out to the hotel’s management to request compensation or an upgrade for the remainder of your stay. Would you like me to assist with that process?
No, I shouldn’t have to do that. I’ll be leaving a bad review and never booking with you again.

I completely understand your frustration, Michael, and I truly wish I could do more for you. If there’s anything else I can help with, or if you’d like me to escalate this to our complaints team, please let me know.
No, forget it. You’ve been no help at all.

I’m really sorry to hear that, Michael. If you change your mind or need further assistance, please don’t hesitate to contact us. Thank you for your time, and I do hope future travels bring you a better experience.
